summary: This is an email chain from February 26, 2019, between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding a request for contact information for the National Trafficking Coordinator who had reached out the previous day. The subject line references 'Epstein'.

persons.name: National Trafficking Coordinator
persons.context: A coordinator for the National Exploitation Prevention and Interdiction program who reached out to a U.S. Attorney's Office contact the day before this email.

events.title: National Trafficking Coordinator Outreach
events.description: The National Trafficking Coordinator reached out to a contact at the U.S. Attorney's Office.

keyFacts: The email subject is 'Epstein', indicating the communication is related to the Jeffrey Epstein case.
The email is dated February 26, 2019, which is after Epstein's 2008 conviction but before his 2019 arrest.
The correspondence involves the U.S. Attorney's Office (USANYS) seeking contact info for a federal National Trafficking Coordinator.
The coordinator's role is related to 'Exploitation Prevention and Interdiction', connecting the inquiry to human trafficking investigations.
The document shows inter-agency communication regarding the Epstein case, specifically involving trafficking coordination.
